name: ($)Armament Shop
description: And finally welcome to the Armament area of my shop. Weapons, Armor, First Aid Kits, and more, everything a danger-seeking individual could need to locate treasure with!

quests.name: Awaken the Power
quests.description: Now that we can summon Ender Dragons to fight when we want, and harvest their powerful Hearts of energy, we can further our Draconic research!                         I've compiled some new research notes on a Ritual that will imbue the power of a Dragon Heart into Charged Draconic Blocks, Awakening their power.                      Gather these materials and show them to me. I'm still compiling my notes into a book for you, for now consult the tablet from the Safety Match research.

tasks.longDescription: Such a strong creature has a very powerful heart.
To contain the power of the Awakening Ritual, you'll need to fully charge a Draconium Block.
Send me 4 Draconic Cores to show me you are prepared for the Ritual. I'll send them right back, along with a copy of the notebook.

quests.name: Awakened Armor
quests.description: The strength and raw power of Awakened Draconium has plenty of uses, and easily the most useful for you would probably be to use it as armor, especially if you are looking to fight the Ender Dragons repeatedly.

quests.name: Awakened Tools
quests.description: Awakened Draconium is a very powerful material, harnessing so much power from the Heart of a Dragon combined with a ton of RF Energy.                                        This means we can definitely use it to power up the designs of the Wyvern Tools we made before.

quests.name: Awakened Multitool
quests.description: Having a good set of tools on your belt is fantastic, but when you are battling Ender Dragons and other monsterous boss-like creatures, you need that belt space for other tools and items. Like healing potions, or building materials.                                     In consideration of that, we've come up with a very useful multitool for you, which combines the usefulness of a Pickaxe,  Shovel, and Sword into one single tool!

tasks.longDescription: To make this powerful Staff, we'll need the three base tools from you.

quests.name: Power of Experience
quests.description: Equipment can only get you so far in the world. The rest of it? Experience, of course! This won't impart actual knowledge on you, instead it will give you a sort of boost of subconscious experiences that will help you in your magical pursuits, such as when trying to Enchant something.
prerequisites: {Initial Research}[Its The Name of the Game]

tasks.longDescription: Bottled Knowledge does not come cheap, mind you, but I dare say you can find more uses for it than just drinking it...

quests.name: Helpful Devices
quests.description: Our further research into Draconium and dragons in general has come up with a bunch more helpful devices you might like!             The Advanced Player Detector is an improved version of the Player Detector. 20 block range, lets you camoflauge it, and has an Inverted Redstone Signal mode to save you wiring space! It also has a white/blacklist so you can add your trusted assistants to it and not have them set up off some sort of protective failsafe!                      Then we have the Disenchanter. You can take a magical item and place it in the left slot, an empty book in the center slot, and hit the Transfer button and voila, the top listed enchant has been moved to the book! Careful, as this damages the magical item! You can cut down or outright prevent the damage by surrounding the Disenchanting table with bookshelves.                     Last but not least is the Draconic Chest. It bends space and time so has a giant inventory, as well as a crafting bench inside that. On top of that, it also has a furnace inside of it, which will double Ores smelted inside it. You can hold the chest and Shift + Right Click to change its color before setting it down.

quests.name: Creature Feature
quests.description: You may have noticed, if you've been using your Wyvern weapons, that very rarely, a tiny version of a creature you slaughter will pop out of their corpse.                          This, we've found, is a miniature version of that creature's Soul. The simplest thing you can do with this Soul is to Shift + Right Click it on the ground to summon another of that creature, but this consumes the soul.                                       Thanks to some study by the draconic researchers here, we've discovered you can use a Draconic Core on any Mob Spawner in your world to 'stabilize it', enabling you to move it around.                           You can then place it and Right Click a Mob Soul onto it to have that Stabilized Mob Spawner start spawning that creature. Various items will improve the Mob Spawner when you Right Click them onto it :        Wyvern Core : Tier 2 Upgrade        Awakened Core : Tier 3 Upgrade      Nether Star : Removes requiring a player within 16 blocks.                  Notch Apple : Removes spawning restrictions (light, etc)

tasks.longDescription: To obtain a Stabilized Spawner, Right Click a Draconic Core on any Mob Spawner in the world. You can then break it with your Draconic tools and move it around.

By killing creatures with Draconic weaponry, you can rarely obtain a Mob Soul. Right Clicking it into a Stabilized Mob Spawner will cause it to spawn that creature.         Note that when you break a Stabilized Spawner, you will get back all upgrades EXCEPT the Mob Soul.

The Mob Grinder is a special machine we've come up with that will kill creatures in a 7x7 area in front of it.                                     It can be powered with normal furnace Fuel, or with RF Energy.

quests.name: Crystal Network
quests.description: Now that you are working with massive amounts of power, we wnated to figure out a way to distribute it in a large area without using cables or conduits, since those take up a lot of room.               What we've come up with is a network based on Crystals, transmitting the RF Energy wirelessly between them. Each crystal has a range and a maximum number of other crystals they can connect to, so you'll need to chain crystals together to go farther distances.                                      The primary tool you use to bind crystals together into a network is the Crystal Binder. It has multiple modes you can switch between by Shift + Right Clicking it. As long as you are holding the Crystal Binder, you can see all the connections between nearby Crystals.

tasks.longDescription: You can switch modes by holding the Crystal Binder and doing Shift + Right Click.

The basic crystal is the Relay. It cannot send or receive energy from a block, its whole purpose is to connect Crystals in the network. You'll primarily use it to go further distances or as a connection hub.        Range : 25                                 Max Connections : 10

The Tranceiver is the crystal you'll use to give or take RF Energy from a block. Place it on the side of any RF machine or otherwise, and Bind the crystal to the network. Then change your Crystal Binder to Mode Change and use it on the Tranceiver to switch it between Input and Output mode.        Range : 25                                 Max Connections : 2
The Energy Relay and Tranceivers have Advanced versions you can craft. These double the range and number of connections they can have.

The Wireless Tranceiver enables you to cut down not only on cables, but on using many Crystals in your energy net. You do not need to hook a Tranceiver up to the side of a block anymore to transfer energy to and from it.       To bind a machine to the Energy Net, first use the Crystal Binder in Bind Mode on the Wireless Tranceiver, then on the machine.          Range : 25                                 Wireless Range : 15                      Max Connections : 3                     Max Wireless Connections : 8          As before, the Advanced Version will double all of these limits.

quests.name: Initial Signal
quests.description: So we've been testing some things with Draconium, looking to further our research. We've found lots of great things already, but also come across some small, relatively cheap devices that could help you.                                       First up, a Potentiometer, which can emit a variable strength Redstone Signal between 0 and 15.       Then we have the Rain Sensor, which will emit a Redstone Signal when its, well...raining of course.          Last we have the Player Detector, which will emit a Redstone Signal when you or another assistant gets within about 10 blocks.

tasks.longDescription: These are some fairly cheap items to make, especially when you consider how much the rest of this research is.

quests.name: Round the World
quests.description: The power of Awakened Draconium, when combined with the very essence of Dragons themselves, enable us to make a very special device. One that  can control time itself!                           The Sun Dial, when a Redstone Signal is applied to it, will charge up, and then fire into the sky. Time will then fast forward, not stopping until you stop the Redstone Signal.       This will only affect the placement of the sun itself, it will not fast forward time for your crops or machines.

tasks.longDescription: This item requires us to obtain some...quite dangerous materials from Ender Dragons. Materials that are super fragile as well. Thus, the cost is...a bit extreme.

quests.name: Bones of Dragons
quests.description: The initial idea for my train of research was some of the data I gathered from your world. Specifically, the place you call The End is (or was?) home to a creature of legend : a Dragon. If it exists in your world, surely it exists in others?                            Sure, we have two legged dragons walking about The Business sometimes (they are especially insightful into magical research), but they are nothing like their ancient, mythical ancestors.                                    My research thus far has unconvered what the ancient people called The Bones of Dragons : a mystical metal that is some of the strongest, most magical we've ever seen.                              Thanks to some fairly dangerous research, my team is able to create this metal. Only in tiny batches, and with very expensive ingredients, but we've stockpiled enough to start selling it to you. Both to help us with costs, and to have you utilize it for more research.

tasks.longDescription: There are a few things you can do with Draconium, but my suggestion? Make some Tinker's Tools with it, you won't be disappointed!

quests.name: Awakened Weapons
quests.description: The sheer power of Awakened Draconium can be harnessed in many ways, but one that should definitely benefit you would be to have it forged into powerful weapons.
prerequisites: {Initial Research}[Its The Name of the Game]

quests.name: A Core of Power
quests.description: We need a good way to harness the strength and power of Draconium. One of my researchers suggested that we could shape the metal into a mystical symbol, like a medal.                                           The mystical nature of the shape helps to contain the power into what we are calling a basic Draconium Core.

tasks.longDescription: There isn't much you can do with a basic Draconic Core, but if you combine four of them with a Nether Star, you get a much more poweful item we call a Wyvern Core.             Both of these are key components in Energy Cores, which will be needed for further research.

quests.name: Tools of the Wyvern
quests.description: Draconium is a fantastic material, able to tap into and utilize so much potential power and magic. Hopefully we can unlock its secrets, and it will guide us to getting you out of there, and open up even more doors for all of us.        Shaping it into Cores was an excellent first step, and we've been able to expand upon it. You can make more powerful Cores of varying types just by combining a few together with other powerful materials.                                      We've created some powerful lab equipment that enables us to empower some basic tools with Draconic potential : We simply call them Wyvern Tools.                           Why? Wyverns were, according to some lore, Lesser Dragons. They were Draconic in nature, but not to the mystical levels of full Dragons.        Don't underestimate Wyverns though, as these tools are extremely powerful in their own right.

tasks.longDescription: These tools are immensely powerful, and the machinery to create them is expensive, not to mention the other magical materials we need to harness the energy.

quests.name: Wyvern Battery
quests.description: The Wyvern Energy Core and the power of the Wyvern Tools has shown that we can harness Draconium to store RF Energy in massive amounts.                              We are currently persuing this line of research, and the first thing we've come up with for you is the Wyvern Flux Capacitor, which works much like the other Flux Capacitors you may know of.               Though, I think comparing them is like comparing an AA Battery to a Car Battery...

tasks.longDescription: The Wyvern Flux Capacitor can hold 80 MILLION RF Energy, which is great because Wyvern Tools are very power hungry.

quests.name: Green and Healthy
quests.description: As you've traversed and survived in your world, you may have noticed these little Red and Yellow hearts you can find from various dangerous creatures. Putting them in a vessel enables you to increase your vitality well beyond normal (thanks to the magical nature of your world). We began researching them, and have synthesized a third color for you to use : green. These are fairly expensive to make, but a full set of Green, Yellow, and Red Heart Canisters can make you thrice as healthy as normal!
prerequisites: {Initial Research}[Its The Name of the Game]

quests.name: Penultimate Research
quests.description: Greetings, Bandit. it has been a while since I last contacted you. I am Caigan, CEO of The Ferret Business. I'm extremely pleased at all the progress you've done! It has really helped us improve so many things, get new products on the market, and learn way more about teleportation technology than we've thought possible.              Unfortunately, this has not lead us to a way to get you home. Discover new dimensions and travel to and from them? Sure, we can do that now. Teleport large distances on the same world with very little cost? Yes, we can do that now too thanks to you.                                 But...your predicament has stumped all of our researchers ...and myself. I've taken a personal interest in you, and have created a small team with my very best researchers. I feel the only way to get you home is to delve into the more... mythical approaches.

tasks.longDescription: Our research does not come free. The materials for this are very rare, and I'm going to have to scour some obscure locations for them...                                           But I will give you this for the initial investment. May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.                                  Sorry, I always wanted to use that quote! Here, this match is the first step in my research. It may look like a normal match, but it will create a fire that burns hot, but does not spread. Each match only ignites one fire, but if you put 9 of them together into a Matchbox, you mystically get way more fires!

quests.name: Armor of the Wyvern
quests.description: Now that we have Wyvern Tools, its only logical that the next step we take is to make armor with Draconium and the various Cores.       Just like the tools, Wyvern Armor needs to be charged with RF Energy to function.

tasks.longDescription: It is a fantastic thing to note, though : By wearing a FULL Set of Wyvern Armor, you become completely immune to fire!

quests.name: Dislocated Existance
quests.description: We're starting to delve into more teleportation research using Draconium. We have some promising starts so far!                                The first thing we have come up with is a self teleporter. We call it a Charm of Dislocation. It has limited uses before it breaks, but it seems to be able to 'record' the spot you are standing at, and then later you can use the Charm to teleport right back to that spot.

tasks.longDescription: It seems this Charm can be used about 10 times before it breaks apart. I wonder if we can bolster the energy in it somehow to make it a bit more lasting...

quests.name: Dislocational Control
quests.description: Delving deeper into the teleportation research, we've found a way to compress the power of the Charm of Dislocation and improve on it.                                 The improvements on the Charm of Dislocation are amazing! You can now use it to record multiple locations and choose between them. Just like the normal Charm, it can record your current position, dimension, and direction facing.            This also has the improved benefit of unlimited uses...as long as you power it properly!

tasks.longDescription: The Enhanced Charm of Dislocation utilizes the power of Ender Pearls to enhance its teleportation abilities. You can feed it Ender Pearls via the interface.

quests.name: Somewhat Dislocated
quests.description: With the research into teleportation and the Dislocation Charm continuing, we looked into ways to mount the Charm into a machine, as well as other ways to teleport and distort reality.               First, we wanted a way to teleport to a destination saved in the Disloaction Charm, but leave the Charm behind for others to use, and we've succeeded in making a...well, a magical pedastal for your Dislocation Charms. The bonus of using the Pedastal is that it will not consume charges on your Charms.       The second thing we discovered is that we could replace the head of an Arrow with an Ender Pearl, but it can only be fired with one of the Draconic Bows. It also is a whole lot more dangerous... bring some safe falling gear at minimum...                             The final thing we've learned is how to make a Draconic Flame, which seems to distort whatever its placed against, allowing us to peer through it like a magic mirror.

tasks.longDescription: If you rename the basic Charm in an Anvil, or have a destination set with the Enhanced version, it will display the name of the location above the Pedastal when you place the Charm in it.

quests.name: Re-Awaken The Dragon
quests.description: We've found if you put a Block of Draconium into any RF charger machine or Capacitor, it will absorb RF Energy. When it absorbs 1 Million RF, it...changes. It becomes a Charged Draconium Block, teeming with stored energy.                         We've done some extensive testing here, and called in a few of those Dragons I mentioned before, one of them from the Blood Magic labs. He helped us create a ritual...     One to summon yourself an Ender Dragon, one more powerful than the one located in The End in your world.

tasks.longDescription: Killing creatures with a Wyvern or other Draconic weapon can sometimes sever their soul from their body. You can use four of them and some other materials to create a Resurrection Stone.
Send me one of the Charged Draconium Blocks to show me that you have the capability to power up one. The Tablet from the Safety Match research should show you how to do this ritual.

quests.name: Simple Draconic Devices
quests.description: Some initial research into the Draconic and Wyvern Cores has netted us some really interesting things.                                          The first is a Particle Generator, which can be used to make pretty effects, though we think it can be used for much much more.                                           The second thing we've come up with is a Weather Controller. Using Emeralds as a catalyst, you can control the weather in your world.      The final thing we have is a low power, but useful, Generator to add to your plethora of ways to generate RF Energy.

tasks.longDescription: These might be of even more use down the line, but for now, everything we successfully make with Draconium evolves our knowledge just one step further.

quests.name: The Core
quests.description: Our research has been requiring more and more RF Energy to harness the power of Draconium, so we've had to make a few side projects to expand our research into new technology.                         This side tangent has become amazingly evolutionary in the field of Energy Storage! With this, we can store not just millions, but BILLIONS, even Trillions, of RF Energy!                                         There is way more to it than I can explain over the QUEST Tablet. I am rewriting the documentation I came up with. For now, consult the tablet you can get from the Safety Matches research.

quests.name: A Powerful Charge
quests.description: With the new crazy power system we've created, most of our charging stations just don't seem to cut it with the massive amounts of Energy we can move around.          With further research, we've found a way to transfer power at a much higher rate with this machine. The Infuser charges items much faster than any other charger we have...I think. Its pretty amazing!                                          With the massive amounts of Flux we're dealing with, we've also begun looking into ways to better control the flow of it, and anything else. Gates are a good way to do this, and we have two we've made to deal with massive flow amounts : Flux and Fluid. When you place them down, the Input (Blue) face will always be towards you, with the Output (Orange) face being opposite.

quests.name: Dragon Cube
quests.description: Draconium itself is fairly expensive, but since you've done a lot for The Business, you've probably got a lot of Trade Vouchers available, right? Well, to save you hitting buttons again and again in your QUEST Tablet, you can purchase a Block of Draconium with a single purchase. It doesn't change how much it costs or how much Loyalty you earn, but it saves clicking so much!

quests.name: Dragon Gate
quests.description: We've learned that we can take some Draconium Dust and mix it into some Obsidian with the help of some Blaze Powder. The resultant material is fairly strong, strong enough to resist the destructive nature of some powerful creatures such as the Wither.                          Further research into this Infused Obsidian shows that you can make a Portal with it, quite similar to the Obsidian portal you can make to reach the Nether. You'll need a Dislocator Receptical though as part of the frame, and you can use a Dislocation Charm to set the destination.
